newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA M1 UP 0.78 PCT, M2 RISES 1.65 PCT IN WEEK.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA M1 UP 0.78 PCT, M2 RISES 1.65 PCT IN WEEK.

text.p: Bulgarian M1 money supply edged up to 142 billion levs on August 16 from 140.9 billion levs on August 9 and M2 rose to 776.1 billion levs from 763.5 billion levs, preliminary central bank figures showed.

Total broad money grew 1.53 percent to 801.1 billion levs as lev-denominated broad money edged up 0.31 percent to 478.8 billion levs and dollar-denominated broad money rose 3.4 percent to 322.3 billion levs.
Hard currency-denominated term deposits of companies and individuals totalled $ 1.576 billion on August 16, up $24 million from the week before.
Lev-denominated term deposits of companies and individuals inched up to 278.7 billion levs from 277.3 billion levs. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
